author: Biff

comments.content: It’s a Didot but not sure which... this looks old and possibly pre-digital.

It’s not [HFJ Didot](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203195429/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100004) nor [FF Cellini Titling](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203195429/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/cellini/titling-regular/) nor [EF Bodoni Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203195429/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef-typeshop/bodoni/light/) … is it?

HTF Didot will get you close but it lacks those swoopy serifs on the C and S.

Some interesting manipulation here, such as the chopped off serif on the V in AVEDON for kerning purposes. And likewise the A in TRUMAN. Actually the A has been messed around with a lot. This lends evidence to my sense that this was done by hand, back in the day.

Actually Bauer Bodoni may be even closer but it has ink traps in the A for example, that this lacks.

<cite>back in the day</cite>  
Oh, I see this was published in 1959! Okay, then I agree _H&FJ_ Didot is the closest you can get.
